title: Region bounded by y=SQRTx and y=x/2 part - b

content.description: Let R be the region bounded by the graphs of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <msqrt> <mi>x</mi> </msqrt> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C57@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D27@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, as shown in the figure above.
content.question: The region R is the base of a solid. For this solid, the cross sections perpendicular to the x-axis are squares. Find the volume of this solid.

frqParts.text: The region R is the base of a solid. For this solid, the cross sections perpendicular to the x-axis are squares. Find the volume of this solid.

topic.text: 8.7: Volumes with Cross Sections - Squares and Rectangles

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
